intro: Chloranthus kiangsiensis, commonly known as the Kiangsi chloranthus, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and simple, alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. Its botanical features include a short stem and clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study.
